contentitems.title: Suspended NDP rookie apologizes to LGBT community for 'gay boyz' post

headlinemedia.title: Deborah Drever, Alberta NDP MLA
headlinemedia.description: Incoming Alberta premier Rachel Notley has suspended Deborah Drever, a rookie member of her caucus, over a controversial photo.
headlinemedia.deck: Incoming Alberta premier Rachel Notley has suspended Deborah Drever, a rookie member of her caucus, over a controversial photo.

contentitems.description: Deborah Drever, who was suspended from the Alberta NDP caucus last week after a series of social media gaffes, is once again apologizing for her "problematic" posts but has no plans of resigning.
contentitems.deck: 'I am ready to work hard to ensure my constituents are well-represented,' says Drever on Facebook

headlineimage.title: Bouncy Castle takes off in Florida

contentitems.title: Florida tornado blows bouncy castle away with 3 kids inside

headlinemedia.title: Bouncy Castle takes off in Florida

contentitems.description: Two inflatable bounce houses — one of them with three kids inside — were uprooted from a Florida beach party Monday afternoon after a waterspout came ashore.
contentitems.deck: Children injured falling out of airborne bouncy castle after waterspout rocks Memorial Day beach party

contentitems.description: Canadians wondering about how they are going to fund their retirement could eventually see a new, voluntary program that lets them bump up their contributions to the Canada Pension Plan, Finance Minister Joe Oliver says.
contentitems.deck: Mandatory increase in CPP still considered 'payroll tax' by Conservative government

headlineimage.title: Westwood Mine

headlinemedia.deck: Rescue teams are using remote-controlled machinery to reach the remaining 8 miners, trapped nearly one kilometre underground.

contentitems.description: After being trapped for nearly 18 hours, nine miners have been rescued and are back on the surface following a collapse at a gold mine in the Abitibi region of Quebec.
contentitems.deck: 2nd collapse at mine in 4 months, likely caused by seismic activity

headlineimage.title: Michelko1
headlineimage.description: For the past decade, Vancouver private investigator Ray Michalko has doggedly pursued his own murder investigations along B.C.'s Highway of Tears on his own time.
headlineimage.deck: For the past decade, Vancouver private investigator Ray Michalko has doggedly pursued his own murder investigations along B.C.'s Highway of Tears on his own time.

contentitems.title: 'I'm not a quitter,' says ex-cop trying to crack Highway of Tears cases on his own time

headlineimage.title: Ex-Cop Probes Missing Women Cases (Full Story)

headlinemedia.title: Ex-Cop Probes Missing Women Cases (Full Story)
headlinemedia.description: Former RCMP officer Ray Michalko is single-handedly trying to solve  cases of missing Aboriginal women along B.C.'s Highway of Tears.
headlinemedia.deck: Former RCMP officer Ray Michalko is single-handedly trying to solve  cases of missing Aboriginal women along B.C.'s Highway of Tears.

contentitems.description: For the past decade, Vancouver private investigator Ray Michalko has doggedly pursued murder investigations on the infamous Highway of Tears on his own time. 'I'm stubborn. I'm not a quitter,' says the 67-year-old former RCMP officer. Watch The National tonight for more on this story.
contentitems.deck: P.I. Ray Michalko on a mission to solve cases of missing and murdered in northern B.C.

headlineimage.title: Sexting texting
headlineimage.description: Health officials in Washington state claim that on at least one occasion, Zilberstein sent 45 sexually explicit text messages while working as an anaesthesiologist for medical procedures like caesarean deliveries.

contentitems.description: Canadian telecommunications providers have been handing over vast amounts of customer information to law enforcement and government departments and agencies with little transparency or oversight, a new report says.
contentitems.deck: Canadian governments, telecoms lag other countries when it comes to transparency about surveillance

headlineimage.title: We Are Always Listening
headlineimage.description: While presented as an actual NSA initiative, the creators of wearealwayslistening.com make their actual views clear with a prominent link to an ACLU petition about letting Section 215 of the Patriot Act expire.

contentitems.description: New York artists posing as 'freelance' NSA agents are secretly recording the private conversations people have in restaurants, and then publishing them online for all to hear.
contentitems.deck: 'Freelance' NSA spies say they've installed audio recorders in cafes, bars, restaurants and gyms around NYC

headlineimage.title: Brassard-Bishop

headlinemedia.deck: The Rangers Derick Brassard opened the scoring early in the first period against Lightning goaltender Ben Bishop in Game 6 of the Eastern Conference final.

contentitems.description: Derek Brassard had a hat trick and Henrik Lundqvist stopped 36 shots in another season-saving performance as the New York Rangers beat the Tampa Bay Lightning 7-3 Tuesday night to force Game 7 in the Eastern Conference finals.
contentitems.deck: Henrik Lundqvist, scoring burst rescue New York once again

headlineimage.title: Coalmont phone crash
headlineimage.description: Coalmont's public phone booth was destroyed in March after this vehicle crashed into it as part of what police claim was an ongoing feud.
headlineimage.deck: Coalmont's public phone booth was destroyed in March after this vehicle crashed into it as part of what police claim was an ongoing feud.

contentitems.title: Phone booth destroyed in bizarre B.C. feud to be replaced

headlinemedia.deck: Coalmont's public phone booth was destroyed in March after this vehicle crashed into it as part of what police claim was an ongoing feud.

contentitems.description: Residents of the tiny B.C. town of Coalmont have successfully lobbied Telus to replace a phone booth destroyed during an alleged attempted murder.
contentitems.deck: Telus initially said it would not replace the phone booth — but residents refused to take no for an answer

contentitems.title: Kids' motor, social skills improve when cord cutting delayed
contentitems.description: Children developed better fine-motor skills when the clamping of their umbilical cord at birth was delayed several minutes compared with just seconds, according to a new randomized trial.
contentitems.deck: Boys, more prone to iron deficiency after birth than girls, showed more improvements

headlineimage.title: cavs-052615-620
headlineimage.description: LeBron James and Kyrie Irving slap hands during a timeout in the first half of Game 4 of the Eastern Conference Finals against the Atlanta Hawks on Tuesday in Cleveland.
headlineimage.deck: LeBron James and Kyrie Irving slap hands during a timeout in the first half of Game 4 of the Eastern Conference Finals against the Atlanta Hawks on Tuesday in Cleveland.

contentitems.title: LeBron James reaches 5th straight NBA finals, with Cleveland

headlinemedia.title: cavs-052615-620
headlinemedia.description: LeBron James and Kyrie Irving slap hands during a timeout in the first half of Game 4 of the Eastern Conference Finals against the Atlanta Hawks on Tuesday in Cleveland.
headlinemedia.deck: LeBron James and Kyrie Irving slap hands during a timeout in the first half of Game 4 of the Eastern Conference Finals against the Atlanta Hawks on Tuesday in Cleveland.

contentitems.description: LeBron James scored 23 points, Kyrie Irving returned after missing two games and the Cleveland Cavaliers reserved a spot in the NBA Finals with a 118-88 victory over the Atlanta Hawks on Tuesday night to win the Eastern Conference title.
contentitems.deck: LeBron James making 5th straight trip to NBA Finals

headlineimage.title: Del6417728
headlineimage.description: An Indian child cools off in a pond near India Gate amid soaring temperatures in New Delhi on May 24, 2015.
headlineimage.deck: An Indian child cools off in a pond near India Gate amid soaring temperatures in New Delhi on May 24, 2015.

contentitems.title: India's deadly heatwave kills 750 as temperature nears 50 C

headlinemedia.title: Del6417728
headlinemedia.description: An Indian child cools off in a pond near India Gate amid soaring temperatures in New Delhi on May 24, 2015.
headlinemedia.deck: An Indian child cools off in a pond near India Gate amid soaring temperatures in New Delhi on May 24, 2015.

contentitems.description: More than 750 people have died in southern India since the middle of April as soaring summer temperatures scorch the country. Resident are being urged to stay hydrated and remain indoors as much as possible.
contentitems.deck: Daily temperatures in states of Andhra Pradesh and Telengana hit between 45 and 48 C

contentitems.title: Economist magazine calls Vancouver 'mind-numbingly boring'
contentitems.description: A columnist with The Economist magazine has taken another pot shot at Vancouver and its consistently high rankings on livability indexes— but the city remains in great company, it would appear.
contentitems.deck: Travel columnist says the B.C. city may be nice, but where is the fun in that?

headlineimage.title: St-Leonard home
headlineimage.description: A home in St-Leonard was searched on Tuesday morning, linked to a police investigation into youth suspected of trying to go overseas to join jihadists.

headlinemedia.deck: A home in St-Leonard was searched on Tuesday morning, linked to a police investigation into youth suspected of trying to go overseas to join jihadists.

contentitems.description: RCMP and Montreal police carried out several raids around the city today, at least two of which were connected to the 10 Montreal youth recently arrested on suspicion of trying to leave the country to join jihadists in Turkey and Syria.
contentitems.deck: Police seen removing boxes and computers from home in St-Leonard borough

contentitems.title: Wealthy Toronto residents don't want neighbours with sub-million-dollar condos
